meanings.definition: The act of marking with fine parallel lines.
meanings.sent1: The artist used hatching to create shadows in the drawing.
meanings.sent2: The hatching on the map indicated the mountain range.
meanings.sent3: The detective found the secret message hidden in the hatching on the paper.
meanings.sent4: The hatching on the fabric resembled a delicate lace pattern.
meanings.sent5: The hatching on the sketch made the apple look more realistic.

meanings.definition: A method of shading using closely spaced parallel lines.
meanings.sent1: The art teacher explained how hatching can add depth to a drawing.
meanings.sent2: The portrait was beautifully shaded with intricate hatching.
meanings.sent3: The comic book artist used hatching to give the character a dramatic look.
meanings.sent4: The hatching on the painting created a sense of movement in the scene.
meanings.sent5: The hatching technique made the artwork appear three-dimensional.

meanings.definition: The process of a bird incubating eggs until they hatch.
meanings.sent1: The mother bird's hatching of the eggs was a delicate task.
meanings.sent2: The hatching period for robins usually lasts about two weeks.
meanings.sent3: The impatient chick asked its mother if the hatching was done yet.
meanings.sent4: The hatching of the eggs was a natural wonder to observe.
meanings.sent5: The hatching process is crucial for the survival of the bird species.

meanings.definition: A group of young animals that have recently hatched.
meanings.sent1: The farmer checked on the chicken hatching in the coop.
meanings.sent2: The ducklings followed their mother after hatching from the eggs.
meanings.sent3: The children were excited to see the new hatching of chicks at the farm.
meanings.sent4: The hatching of the turtles was a mesmerizing sight on the beach.
meanings.sent5: The hatching of the baby birds brought joy to the whole family.
